intro: Anthephora angustifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaf anthephora, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, opposite leaves that are typically narrow and lance-shaped. Its flowers are usually white or pale yellow, clustered in dense inflorescences, and it produces small, round berries that are edible. Anthephora angustifolia is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
